excerpt: This convent on the city's highest hill dates to 1607 & offers a leafy cloister & sweeping views.
detail_description: Perched atop the highest hill in Cartagena, the Convent of Santa Cruz de la Popa is a 17th-century religious complex offering breathtaking views of the city and the Caribbean Sea. The monastery features a leafy cloister, a 21k gold-laden chapel, and a tranquil inner courtyard with a statue of the Virgin of Cadelaria. Despite enduring damage from attacks on Cartagena, the convent has been extensively restored over the years.
name: Convent of Santa Cruz de la Popa
address: Cl. 37, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Hip Getsemani centers on Holy Trinity Square, where laid-back groups gather to drink beer, listen to street musicians and snack on grilled arepas from nearby stalls. Lively pizzerias and casual bistros serving Colombian staples line the surrounding streets, which are also known for their vivid murals. Brewpubs, cocktail bars and the amed salsa bar Cafe Havana, keep the party vibe going till the early hours.
detail_description: Getsemani is a vibrant neighborhood in Cartagena, Colombia, known for its lively atmosphere and local soul. The area is centered around Holy Trinity Square, where visitors can enjoy street musicians, grilled arepas, and a variety of dining options including pizzerias and casual bistros. Colorful murals adorn the surrounding streets, adding to the neighborhood's charm.
name: Getsemani
address: Cartagena, Cartagena Province, Bolivar, Colombia

excerpt: Imposing hilltop fortress built in the 1600s with a complex tunnel system & offering audio tours.
detail_description: San Felipe de Barajas Fort, a hilltop fortress built in the 1600s, is a must-visit landmark in Cartagena. The fort offers audio tours and boasts a complex tunnel system for visitors to explore. Strategically positioned on San Lazaro hill, it provides an impressive view of the city and its surroundings. This UNESCO World Heritage Site is named after Philip IV of Spain and has gradually been constructed over 120 years.
name: San Felipe de Barajas Fort
address: Cielo mar, La Boquilla, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Bustling plaza featuring outdoor restaurants & bars, buskers, vendors & a sculpture by Botero.
detail_description: Plaza de Santo Domingo is a lively and bustling square in Cartagena, Colombia. The highlight of the plaza is the sculpture of La Gorda, a reclining nude bronze statue by Colombian sculptor Fernando Botero. This simple plaza is dominated by restaurants and often filled with street vendors selling artwork and souvenirs. Visitors can enjoy delicious cuisine at the fantastic restaurants while being entertained by street performers.
name: Plaza de Santo Domingo
address: Cl. 35, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Vendors specialize in Bolivian & Cuban rice dishes, seafood & juices along this busy shopping strip.
detail_description: Mercado de Bazurto is a bustling food market in Cartagena that offers a real slice of local life. It's a vibrant and overwhelming experience, with vendors specializing in Bolivian and Cuban rice dishes, seafood, juices, and more. The market sells everything from fresh fruit to cooked turtle, showcasing a wide array of produce at very affordable prices.
name: Bazurto Market
address: Unnamed Road, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Cartagena is a port city on Colombia’s Caribbean coast. By the sea is the walled Old Town, founded in the 16th century, with squares, cobblestone streets and colorful colonial buildings. With a tropical climate, the city is also a popular beach destination. Reachable by boat are Isla de Barú, with white-sand beaches and palm trees, and the Islas del Rosario, known for their coral reefs.
detail_description: Cartagena, a picturesque port city on Colombia's Caribbean coast, boasts a walled Old Town with charming cobblestone streets and vibrant colonial buildings dating back to the 16th century. This tropical destination is popular for its beautiful beaches and offers easy access to stunning islands like Isla de Barú and Islas del Rosario, known for their white-sand beaches, palm trees, and coral reefs. The city's rich history and Spanish Colonial architecture make it an alluring travel destination.
name: Cartagena
address: Cartagena Province, Bolivar, Colombia

excerpt: Small urban square known for food sellers, plus colorful buildings & murals in surrounding streets.
detail_description: Plaza de la Trinidad is a vibrant urban square in the heart of Getsemani, known for its lively atmosphere and colorful surroundings. The area is filled with food vendors, colorful buildings, and striking murals that adorn the streets. Visitors can immerse themselves in the local culture by enjoying Champeta music, watching street performers dance for tips, and witnessing children playing around the church's staircases.
name: Plaza de la Trinidad
address: Esquina con, Cl. 29 #174, Getsemaní, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Grand 16th-century church with a museum dedicated to its namesake, a canonized early abolitionist.
detail_description: Santuario de San Pedro Claver is a 16th-century church in Cartagena, dedicated to the Spanish Jesuit priest, San Pedro Claver. He was an early abolitionist who defended black people of African origin during the open slave trade in Cartagena and the Spanish Empire. The church also houses a museum dedicated to his legacy.
name: Santuario de San Pedro Claver
address: Plaza de San Pedro Claver, Cra. 4 #30-01, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Bocagrande is an upmarket area popular for its long, sandy beaches backed by palm-lined promenades. There are several casinos, along with an eclectic dining scene that includes beach snack bars, stylish Japanese and Colombian restaurants, global fast-food chains and mellow cafe terraces. Smart boutiques sell local and international fashion, while Plaza Bocagrande is an upscale mall with sea views.
detail_description: Bocagrande is a trendy area in Cartagena known for its expansive sandy beaches and vibrant atmosphere. The palm-lined promenades offer a variety of dining options, from beach snack bars to upscale Japanese and Colombian restaurants, as well as global fast-food chains. Visitors can explore smart boutiques selling local and international fashion, or visit Plaza Bocagrande, an upscale mall with sea views.
name: Bocagrande
address: Cartagena, Cartagena Province, Bolivar, Colombia

excerpt: Popular watering hole for classic Cuban cocktails & live salsa music in festive, old-world digs.
detail_description: Café Havana is a lively spot in Cartagena known for its classic Cuban cocktails and live salsa music. The festive atmosphere and old-world charm make it a popular watering hole for locals and tourists alike. Located in the Getsemani neighborhood, this vibrant venue opens five nights a week until 4a.m., offering an authentic nightclub experience with energetic salsa music, a beautiful bar, and plenty of ceiling fans to keep patrons cool as they dance the night away.
name: Café Havana
address: Cra. 10 #ESQUINA, Getsemaní, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Dating to the 1800s, this monumental stone gateway in the city walls features a spired clocktower.
detail_description: The Monumento Torre del Reloj, a monumental stone gateway with a spired clocktower dating back to the 1800s, is an iconic landmark in Cartagena. It serves as the official entrance to the downtown area and opens out onto the lively marketplace of Plaza de los Coches. Nearby, visitors can explore other attractions such as Teatro Heredia, San Pedro Claver Church, Plaza de Bolivar, and Santa Domingo Church.
name: Monumento Torre del Reloj
address: Boca del Puente, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: The cells of these former 18th-century dungeons now feature shops selling colorful souvenirs.
detail_description: Las Bóvedas, built in the late 18th century, was originally a munitions storehouse and later used as a dungeon during the Wars of Independence. The structure features 47 porticos and 23 domes and is located within the walls of Cartagena's Old City. Today, it houses artisan craft markets in its former cells, making it a popular tourist attraction.
name: Las Bóvedas
address: San Diego, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: This museum focuses on pre-Columbian relics, with 600+ gold, silver & ceramic pieces on display.
detail_description: The Museo del Oro Zenú, part of the Central Bank and established in 1982, showcases over 600 pre-Columbian artifacts including gold, silver, and ceramic pieces. The museum offers a glimpse into the history of Colombia's indigenous Zenu people through its exhibits. Visitors can explore various time periods such as the Middle Ages and admire traditional attire and handicrafts.
name: Museo del Oro Zenú
address: Parque o Plaza, Cra 4, de Bolívar #33-26, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Iconic public square surrounded by a historic cathedral, museum & government buildings.
detail_description: Plaza de Bolívar is a historic public square in Cartagena, surrounded by significant landmarks such as the 16th-century cathedral, the Palace of Inquisition, and the Zenu Gold Museum. The area also features attractions like Teatro Heredia, Puerta del Reloj, San Pedro Claver Church, and Santa Domingo Church with its sculpture Mujer Reclinada by Fernando Botero.
name: Plaza de Bolívar
address: Cra. 5 #33-15, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Walled City Walkers offers an immersive and informative walking tour experience through the historic walled cities of various destinations. The tours are led by knowledgeable guides who share fascinating stories about the history, culture, and architecture of these ancient cities. Participants can explore hidden gems, picturesque streets, and iconic landmarks while learning about the rich heritage of the walled cities.
name: Walled City Walkers
address: Urb. Bulevard la Cast, B2-302, Villa Sandra, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Bright rooms, some with terraces, in a laid-back hotel offering free Wi-Fi & a hot tub.
detail_description: OLD TOWN HOUSE is a laid-back hotel with bright rooms, some featuring terraces and free Wi-Fi. The historic district within the walled city boasts colonial buildings, churches, and plazas like Plaza Bolivar, where visitors can enjoy traditional Colombian music performances. Families often spend time in the Old Town and Getsemani for their colorful street art. Boca Grande is known for its high-rise hotels along the beachfront and casinos.
name: OLD TOWN HOUSE
address: Centro Amurallado, Calle del Jardin No 39-65 Barrio, San Diego, Cartagena de Indias, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Café del Mural is a charming coffee spot nestled in the Getsemani neighborhood. It offers a wide variety of delicious coffee options and delectable baked goods, including unique treats like Colombian affogato with homemade ice cream. The cafe also hosts coffee roasting workshops for enthusiasts interested in learning the traditional Colombian method. The owner, David, is passionate and knowledgeable about coffee and offers an array of preparation methods, from modern techniques to traditional espresso.
name: Café del Mural
address: Cl. de San Juan # 25-60, Getsemaní, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Intimate restaurant offering traditional dishes, including seafood meals & snacks.
detail_description: Restaurante Celele is a cozy dining spot that fulfills the culinary vision of Colombian chefs Jaime Rodriguez and Sebastian Pinzon. Located in a historic building with rustic charm in Cartagena's Getsemani neighborhood, this restaurant offers an intimate setting for savoring traditional dishes, particularly seafood specialties and snacks.
name: Celele.
address: Calle del Espíritu Santo, Cra. 10c #29-200, Getsemaní, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia

detail_description: Media Luna Hostel in Cartagena is a popular choice for solo travelers and groups looking for shared or single rooms. The hostel offers a vibrant atmosphere with its Mega Party night on Wednesdays, making it the go-to place for those seeking an exciting nightlife experience. While not considered luxurious, it's perfect for travelers who prioritize round-the-clock partying over accommodation quality. The hostel's central location allows guests to explore the neighborhood and interact with friendly locals without language barriers.
name: Media Luna Hostel - Cartagena
address: 10-46 Media Luna 10, Getsemaní, Cartagena de Indias, Bolívar, Colombia

excerpt: Spacious plaza surrounded by colonial-era buildings, with a statue of Christopher Columbus.
detail_description: Plaza de la Aduana is a spacious square surrounded by colonial-era buildings and features a statue of Christopher Columbus. It is a popular spot for live music and dancing, offering a vibrant atmosphere to experience the local culture. Nearby, Plaza de Santo Domingo also provides lively entertainment, while Plaza de San Pedro Claver showcases a church dedicated to the Catalan missionary who worked to protect and assist black slaves.
name: Plaza de la Aduana
address: Cl. 32 #130, El Centro, Cartagena de Indias, Provincia de Cartagena, Bolívar, Colombia
